intro: Zanthoxylum tragodes, commonly known as the Chinese prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and distinctive, spiny twigs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to red, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves contain bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. Zanthoxylum tragodes thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas.
